list_definition.definition: (sometimes with up) to cut (into small pieces)
a slice of mutton, pork etc containing a rib
the jaws or mouth, especially of an animal

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The tiger was licking its chops.

list_ex_of_english: As he rightly says, such a drink includes the entire fruit, pips and everything, all chopped up in a mechanical process.
Bus services have been chopped while fares have been increased in proportions previously unknown.
The hay was chopped and placed in troughs made out ofmetal drums.
The fact that space is not composed of points entails that space does not come already ' chopped up ' into sub-regions.
If ever he were to live in a totalitarian society, he would be the first to have his head chopped off.
After harvesting the grain, the crop residues from each plot were chopped into 40 + 60 mm pieces and divided according to treatments.
Fish were transferred gently to large covered glass aquaria provided with a continuous flow of fresh seawater and fed fresh chopped fish every 2 days.
Over the years our investment programme has been bedevilled by the fact that we keep chopping and changing.
